UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Search for Shorter Portions of the Proline-Rich Antimicrobial Peptide Fragment Bac5(1-25) That Retain Antimicrobial Activity by Blocking Protein Synthesis.
Literature.Author: Mardirossian M, Sola R, Degasperi M, Scocchi M

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli BW25113(MIC=2µM),Escherichia coli BW25113(MBC=6µM),Escherichia coli BW25113 del-sbmA(MIC=32µM),Escherichia coli BW25113 del-sbmA(MBC=>64µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=2µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MBC=2µM),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MIC=1µM),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MBC=2µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028(MIC=4µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028(MBC=32µM),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=32µM),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MBC=64µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=32µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MBC=>64µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=>64µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MBC=>64µM)
